revised_title: Investigations on the Development of the Olfactory Nerve and Olfactory Organ in Vertebrates
tldr: The author examines the development of the olfactory nerve and olfactory organ in various vertebrates, concluding that they share a similar mode of development with other cranial nerves. The study also reveals that the olfactory nerve is a primary nerve, comparable to segmental cranial nerves, and that the olfactory tract and bulb do not appear until a late stage of development, providing no grounds for separating the olfactory nerve from other cranial nerves.
